intro: Phanera harmsiana var. media, commonly known as the slender phanera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
